message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has anemia, positive direct antiglobulin test, and normal LFTs, creatinine, and coagulation studies, which suggest drug-induced immune hemolytic reaction. Preeclampsia and HELLP syndrome would have abnormal LFTs and elevated blood pressure. Hereditary spherocytosis may be characterized by hemolytic anemia but is not associated with a positive direct antiglobulin test.
